Please talk to your doctor to check your blood glucose levels and to do a complete thyroid panel.  The symptoms you mention sound like hyperthyroidism which can be dangerous if your TSH level gets too low (thyroid storm).Here are some of the symptoms of hyperthyroidism:PalpitationsHeat intoleranceNervousnessInsomniaBreathlessnessIncreased bowel movementsLight or absent menstrual periodsFatigueWeight lossIf you have a majority of these symptoms you need treatment.  Here is more info: http://www.endocrineweb.com/hyper1.html
